page.title: 10THE MULLARD FACTORY B'BURN.
page.content: The Mullard factory site covers an area of 50 acres, since the factory was opened in 1938 over a dozen buildings have been added. At present some of these buildings are no longer in use and the workforce has been reduced from a peak of 6000 to 1250. Today , along with some electronic components Mullard a part of the Philips company, is the sole U.K. producer of the Laser-Vision Disc on which the Domesday Data will be presented. About 200 people are involved in the production of the disc and 30,000 are produced each week. The production of the disc began in 1980 and the process now operates 24 hours a day, 7 days a week. The Laser-Vision disc is a sophisticated video information storage system which can give easy access to large amounts of stored data, both pictures and text.
